sn35.136:2.4: Notice the positive association of “exist” (atthi).
sn35.136:7.4: Bodhi translates “dullards”, evidently reading magā (“beasts”) and taking to mean “fools”. However, I can’t find support for this sense in Pali or Sanskrit. The commentary explains it as those inexpert in knowing what is the path and what is not the path, apparently taking maggā as a truncation of maggāmagga. I read as a secondary derivative from magga in the old sense “seeking”, with the -a suffix making it the agentive “seekers”.
